creditline: The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund and the David and Ruth Waterbury Endowment for Contemporary Craft
description: organic, curving, turned wood-like form with central open spaces; reddish finish
text: Considered one of the world’s great masters of contemporary sculpture, Tony Cragg has taken a highly inventive approach to materials and form since he first appeared on the scene in the late 1970s. Pulse represents both his formal and technical brilliance. Made from kerto, a wood supplement commonly used in housing construction, the sculpture complements the museum’s strong collection of decorative, industrial, and craft-based works. Cragg’s sculpture transforms this new type of construction material beyond its initial intentions into an outstanding work of art.
title: Pulse
